form_inconsistencies: Modern channeled sources show disagreement on Lyran physical characteristics. Lyssa Royal Holt's 'Prism of Lyra' (1989) describes varied physical forms within the Lyran system including some feline-featured beings alongside humanoids. Barbara Marciniak's 'Bringers of the Dawn' (1992) emphasizes humanoid forms with twelve DNA strands without explicit feline references. No ISBN-backed sources found for avian characteristics; avian trait dropped due to blog-only sourcing. Ancient Greek sources describe only the lyre instrument itself with no physical being descriptions beyond Orpheus as human poet-musician.
lyran_draco_war: No ISBN-backed sources found documenting Lyran-Draco conflict. This narrative appears primarily in blog and website sources without published book verification. Trait dropped due to lack of acceptable sources meeting research standards.
ancient_vs_modern_disconnect: CRITICAL DISTINCTION: Ancient Greek mythology provides constellation origin only (Orpheus' lyre placed among stars by the Muses after his death). Modern channeled material (1989-2011) describes 'Lyran race' as primordial humanoid progenitors with NO CONNECTION to ancient constellation myths. Greek sources (Hyginus Ovid Apollodorus) document musical/artistic symbolism via Orpheus myth. Channeled sources (Royal Holt Marciniak Cannon Nidle) describe extraterrestrial civilizations and soul evolution. These are separate mythological systems with no historical bridge. Ancient support for Lyran race concept = UNKNOWN as it is exclusively modern channeled material.

disputed_points.consensus: low - Blavatsky's Secret Doctrine describes Earth-based root race evolution with no explicit connection to Lyra constellation or extraterrestrial Lyran civilizations. Modern channeled Lyran material (1989+) emerged independently without citing Theosophical sources.

research_notes: Research yielded 3 mandatory characteristics with proper citations plus 3 additional characteristics. Ancient Greek sources (Hyginus Ovid Apollodorus) provide HIGH consensus HIGH ancient support LOCKED citations for Orpheus lyre constellation origin. Modern channeled sources (Royal Holt Marciniak Cannon Nidle) provide MEDIUM to LOW consensus UNKNOWN ancient support PROVISIONAL citations for Lyran race narrative. CRITICAL FINDING: Zero connection between ancient constellation myth and modern ET narrative. These are separate mythological traditions. Citation status breakdown: Multiple LOCKED citations from fully accessible ancient sources (Hyginus, Ovid, Apollodorus). 8 PROVISIONAL citations for modern channeled books requiring full text access. Avian characteristics dropped due to blog-only sourcing. Lyran-Draco war dropped due to lack of ISBN sources. Theosophical connection noted as disputed with low consensus. Form inconsistencies documented between feline and humanoid descriptions. All sources meet academic standards with ISBNs or pre-1967 publisher documentation.
